TunableList.name: buffs
TunableList.description: A list of buffs that will be added while this mood is the active mood on a Sim. The first item is applied for the initial intensity, and each subsequent item replaces the previous buff as the intensity levels up.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

TunableVariant.name: buff_source
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableList.name: colored_ghost_list
TunableList.description: List of colored ghost tuning for this mood. Client will go through this list and find the first trait in this list the ghost equipped, then use that entry to apply the special ghost color settings.

Tunable.name: color_saturation
Tunable.description: Color saturation for ghost. Ranged from 0~10, 0: mono, 10:colored

Tunable.name: edge_color_brightness
Tunable.description: Edge color brightness. Ranged from 0~10.

Tunable.name: trait
Tunable.description: The ghost having this trait will have their special color settings.

Tunable.name: environment_scoring_commodity
Tunable.description: Defines the ranges and corresponding buffs to apply for this mood's environmental contribution. Be sure to tune min, max, and the different states. The convergence value is what will remove the buff. Suggested to be 0.

Tunable.name: filter_param_desaturation
Tunable.description: 0 - 1. Controls the amount of color retained by objects behind the ghost. 0 = all color retained, 1 = no color retained.

Tunable.name: filter_param_lens_distortion
Tunable.description: Controls lens distortion effect on the ghost. 0 = no effect, higher value = more distortion

Tunable.name: filter_param_noise_distortion
Tunable.description: Controls the amount of distortion obtained from the noise texture. 0 = no effect, Higher value = more distortion

Tunable.name: filter_param_noise_jumpiness
Tunable.description: Controls the rate at which the input from the noise texture jumps around at random. 0 = no jumpiness, Higher value = more jumpiness

Tunable.name: filter_param_noise_scale_x
Tunable.description: Scales the input from the noise texture horizontally.

Tunable.name: filter_param_noise_scale_y
Tunable.description: Scales the input from the noise texture vertically.

Tunable.name: filter_param_noise_scroll_y
Tunable.description: Controls the rate at which the input from the noise texture scrolls vertically. 0 = no scrolling, Negative value = scrolls up, Positive value = scrolls down.

Tunable.name: filter_param_opacity_offset
Tunable.description: Controls the ghost's opacity. Higher value = more opacity.

TunableList.name: icons
TunableList.description: Icon for the UI tooltip, per intensity.

TunableList.name: intensity_thresholds
TunableList.description: List of thresholds at which the intensity of this mood levels up. If empty, this mood has a single threshold and all mood tuning lists should have a single item in them. For each threshold added, you may add a new item to the Buffs, Mood Names, Portrait Pose Indexes and Portrait Frames lists.

Tunable.name: is_changeable
Tunable.description: If this is checked, any buff with this mood will change to the highest current mood of the same polarity. If there is no mood with the same polarity it will default to use this mood type

TunableVariant.name: mood_asm_param
TunableVariant.description: If set, then this mood will specify an asm parameter to affect animations. If not set, then the ASM parameter will be determined by the second most prevalent mood.

Tunable.name: Specify
Tunable.description: The ASM parameter for Sim's mood, if not set, will use 'xxx' from instance name pattern with 'mood_xxx'.

TunableList.name: mood_colors
TunableList.description: A list of the colors displayed on the steel series mouse when the active Sim has this mood. The first item is applied for the initial intensity, and each subsequent item replaces the color as the intensity levels up.

TunableList.name: mood_frequencies
TunableList.description: A list of the flash frequencies on the steel series mouse when the active Sim has this mood. The first item is applied for the initial intensity, and each subsequent item replaces the value as the intensity levels up. 0 => solid color, otherwise, value => value hertz.

TunableList.name: mood_names
TunableList.description: A list of localized names of this mood. The first item is applied for the initial intensity, and each subsequent item replaces the name as the intensity levels up.

TunableList.name: portrait_frames
TunableList.description: A list of the frame labels (NOT numbers!) from the UI .fla file that the portrait should be set to when this mood is active. Determines background color, font color, etc. The first item is applied for the initial intensity, and each subsequent item replaces the pose as the intensity levels up.

TunableList.name: portrait_pose_indexes
TunableList.description: A list of the indexes of the pose passed to thumbnail generation on the client to pose the Sim portrait when they have this mood. You can find the list of poses in tuning (Client_ThumnailPoses) The first item is applied for the initial intensity, and each subsequent item replaces the pose as the intensity levels up.
